definition: to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy

sentences.english: However, the theory of oil mixture is very complicated, and so is the calculation process.
sentences.chinese: 但是，混油理論非常複雜，計算過程也十分煩瑣。

sentences.english: Machine maintenance work is trivial and boring, but Xiao Wang still treats it seriously and carefully.
sentences.chinese: 機務工作煩瑣，但小王仍認真仔細地對待。

sentences.english: Promote materialist dialectics and oppose metaphysics and scholasticism .
sentences.chinese: 要提倡唯物辯證法，反對形而上學和煩瑣哲學。

sentences.english: Promote materialist dialectics and oppose metaphysics and scholasticism.
sentences.chinese: 要提倡唯物辯證法，反對形而上學和煩瑣哲學。

sentences.english: The traditional cross-section method is very complicated and very cumbersome steps.
sentences.chinese: 而傳統截面法計算很複雜，步驟十分煩瑣。

sentences.english: As you might expect, this communication was very tedious and difficult.
sentences.chinese: 這是你能夠想象的，如此的溝通是十分煩瑣和困難的。
